chara.textHome:
I, um...I'm kind of a bad student,
I can't keep up in school...
I don't have any real talents,

and in the rare case I'm not all bad at
something, I still don't shine...

The world keeps spinning really fast
around me, but I can't move along with it...

So I'm always just running in circles,
going nowhere...

I could just cry...
*Sob*

In my bird encyclopedia
I remember seeing that
there's a bird called a "lyrebird"!
Get it? A liar bird!
No, the bird is a lyrebird, I'm not lying!

I'm not absolutely sure,
but I think I'm doing pretty good?
My mind feels so quiet and peaceful...
It's wonderful...
I have a really weak presence...
I think it's been that way since I was born.

I need to keep changing myself,
no matter what!
O-okay, h-here I go!
Hiii!
H-how was that?

Could you, um, tell I was
trying to be friendly?

Ohh...it's the first time I've even tried...
but I still have so much further to go...
Oh well, I have to keep trying!
Oh, you're here!

Um...thank you so much for 
always coming to see me...
I'm really happy!

I love waking up early.
You get to really enjoy the silence before
everyone starts their day.

It doesn't take long for the city to
 get noisy, though.
Lunchtime, hmmm...

Maybe some rice noodles? Glass noodles?
I could go with some fresh spring rolls too...

Wait a second, all those foods are
 see-through...

It happens every day, but when the
sun sets I always get this sad feeling...
I wonder why?

Especially when the sun is about to dip 
over the horizon I get...

I'm the most happy when I'm asleep.
Once I doze off, and fall into a deep sleep,
there's even a chance I'll have a fun dream!
I hate nightmares, though!

When the sun rises and sets,
today becomes yesterday and
tomorrow becomes today.
Why do you suppose time passes, anyway?
It's kinda strange when you think about it...

Sometimes I wonder if I'm 
really needed in this world...

Perhaps I've been searching for the reason
for my existence ever since I was born...
U-um... I really don't like to fight, but...
I guess I don't have a choice, huh?

*Sigh* What should I do?
Can I really do this?
I don't like the heat.
But, I don't like the cold either...

Also, my allergies are terrible in the
spring, and lately they've been bad
during the fall too.
So, basically, every season is bad for me...

Sometimes fans and air conditioners
have a "Gentle Breeze" setting.

When I see that on the remote, I don't
know why, but I feel like I can relate to it.

No matter how hard I try,
I just can't raise my voice...
I'm never loud enough...
Wanna see?
Okay, here...
Heeeeeey...
What do you think?

I wish I could just brush it off when
people come at me, talking all crazy.

Having a skill like that would be 
perfect for someone like me...
I always feel so unsteady on my feet.
But, somehow...I feel alive.

I want to keep walking if I can,
even if I can only stagger along...
Do you remember Mr. Purrs-a-lot's friends?
Wonderfur the dog and Darkrow the crow...
And don't forget about Curlymagne the lion!

Cats stick their tails straight up when
 they're happy.

But watch out when they 
flick their tails from side to side!
That means they're annoyed.
Iroha, say you'll always be my friend.
Promise me, please!
Okay? Okay?!
Oh...am I being too clingy?
Sorry, but...please promise!
Here I go...

I'm gonna rip those teeth
right out of your mouth!
What do you think? Did I sound strong?
I heard it on TV...
Do we really have to fight?!
I'm so glad... We're alive...
Huh? Really? We won?
Whew... I think we got lucky.
Um... Am I...strong?
Um, er, I-I'm S-Sana...

Sana is my, um, first name,
and my full name is Sana Futaba...
So, um, y-you know...
N-nice to meet you!

What? D-don't tell me...
I got a little stronger?!

I did my best and at last
I've achieved something?
Just move forward one little step at a time...
One little step...

I'm a little jealous of birds...
They can soar so freely through the sky.

I've loved them since I was little so I've
read lots of picture books about them...
I wish I had wings, too...

Bird calls are so pretty.
Robins, skylarks, bush warblers...

I find it really comforting to hear
their voices calling out on the wind.
